skills.title: AngularJS
points: Built and maintained an access control administrative web page to be used by building managers, built using AngularJS.
Built hardware testing and monitoring web page for access control device to be used for device testing and diagnostics, using AngularJS.
Taken three courses for Angular one hosted by Angular Academy and two hosted by Rangle.io.

skills.title: Java
points: Maintained an emergency response administrative page using Java, Apache Tomcat, and Java Spring.
Built a parking kiosk touch screen application to be used by commuters to pay for parking. Built using Java and Java Swing.
Built a program to convert a raw music sheet to a human readable PDF music sheet. Built using Java and Java Swing.

skills.title: jQuery
points: Maintained an access control administrative web page for building managers, built using JQuery. Which was later converted to an AngularJS application.
Taken various courses that cover JQuery at York University.

skills.title: HTML5

Built this webpage using PugJS a HTML templating engine, please feel free to check out the code on GitHub.
Taken various courses that cover HTML5 at York University.

Styled hardware testing and monitoring web page for access control device, using SASS.

skills.title: Bootstrap
points: Built this webpage using a bootstrap, please feel free to check out the code on GitHub.

skills.title: PHP
points: Built and maintained a REST API for an access control administrative web page to be used by building managers, built using PHP, Slim Framework.

projects.name: Web based configuration tool
projects.summary: Building a web page variant of an existing application which is used to configure various access control devices. Make modifications to settings such as schedules, resident directory, credentials, etc.
points: Build a responsive user interface using AngularJS, Bootstrap, JQuery, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.
Build a REST API using MySQL, Apache, PHP, and Slim Framework (PHP framework).

projects.name: MiEntry (Access control app)
projects.summary: Provide residents with a mobile app that allows video calls from access panels and to use a mobile device in place of an access card.
points: Created specifications for team in India to develop for both Android and iOS.
Created test plan to ensure that the specification was met.
Reviewed code to ensure maintainability and prevent potential bugs.

projects.name: Metis Secure (Emergency notification)
projects.summary: Maintaining command center web page, which controls various alarm devices. Being able to send alerts, respond to request for helps with live audio calls, and notify through e-mail and SMS.
points: Using Java, Maven, JavaScript, NetBeans, and Spring Framework
